001package io.jstach.rainbowgum;
002
003import java.net.URI;
004import java.util.List;
005import java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock;
006import java.util.function.Function;
007
008import org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable;
009
010import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogAppender.AbstractLogAppender;
011import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogAppender.ThreadSafeLogAppender;
012import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogConfig.Provider;
013import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogEncoder.Buffer;
014
015/**
016 * Appenders are guaranteed to be written synchronously much like an actor in actor
017 * concurrency.
018 * 
019 * The only exception is if an Appender implements {@link ThreadSafeLogAppender}.
020 */
021public interface LogAppender extends LogLifecycle, LogEventConsumer, LogConfig.Provider<LogAppender> {
022
023        /**
024         * Default Console appender name.
025         */
026        static final String CONSOLE_APPENDER_NAME = "console";
027
028        /**
029         * Default output file appender name.
030         */
031        static final String FILE_APPENDER_NAME = "file";
032
033        /**
034         * Output appender property.
035         */
036        static final String APPENDER_OUTPUT_PROPERTY = LogProperties.APPENDER_OUTPUT_PROPERTY;
037
038        /**
039         * Encoder appender property.
040         */
041        static final String APPENDER_ENCODER_PROPERTY = LogProperties.APPENDER_ENCODER_PROPERTY;
042
043        /**
044         * Batch of events. <strong>DO NOT MODIFY THE ARRAY</strong>. Do not use the
045         * <code>length</code> of the passed in array but instead use <code>count</code>
046         * parameter.
047         * @param events an array guaranteed to be smaller than count.
048         * @param count the number of items.
049         */
050        default void append(LogEvent[] events, int count) {
051                for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
052                        append(events[i]);
053                }
054        }
055
056        public void append(LogEvent event);
057
058        @Override
059        default LogAppender provide(String name, LogConfig config) {
060                return this;
061        }
062
063        /**
064         * Creates a builder.
065         * @param name appender name.
066         * @return builder.
067         */
068        public static Builder builder(String name) {
069                return new Builder(name);
070        }
071
072        /**
073         * Creates a composite log appender from many. The appenders will be appended
074         * synchronously.
075         * @param appenders appenders.
076         * @return appender.
077         */
078        public static LogAppender of(List<? extends LogAppender> appenders) {
079                if (appenders.isEmpty()) {
080                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("A single appender is required");
081                }
082                if (appenders.size() == 1) {
083                        return appenders.get(0);
084                }
085                return new CompositeLogAppender(appenders.toArray(new LogAppender[] {}));
086        }
087
088        /**
089         * Finds an appender based on URI.
090         */
091        public interface AppenderProvider {
092
093                /**
094                 * Loads an appender from a URI.
095                 * @param uri uri.
096                 * @param name name of appender.
097                 * @param config config to access properties and other components like encoders.
098                 * @return appender.
099                 */
100                LogAppender provide(URI uri, String name, LogConfig config);
101
102        }
103
104        /**
105         * Builder for creating standard appenders.
106         * <p>
107         * If the output is not set standard out will be used. If the encoder is not set a
108         * default encoder will be resolved from the output.
109         */
110        public static final class Builder {
111
112                protected @Nullable Provider<LogOutput> output;
113
114                protected @Nullable Provider<LogEncoder> encoder;
115
116                private final String name;
117
118                private Builder(String name) {
119                        this.name = name;
120                }
121
122                /**
123                 * Name of the appender.
124                 * @return name.
125                 */
126                public String name() {
127                        return this.name;
128                }
129
130                /**
131                 * Sets output.
132                 * @param output output.
133                 * @return builder.
134                 */
135                public Builder output(Provider<LogOutput> output) {
136                        this.output = output;
137                        return this;
138                }
139
140                /**
141                 * Sets output.
142                 * @param output output.
143                 * @return builder.
144                 */
145                public Builder output(LogOutput output) {
146                        this.output = Provider.of(output);
147                        return this;
148                }
149
150                /**
151                 * Sets formatter as encoder.
152                 * @param formatter formatter to be converted to encoder.
153                 * @return builder.
154                 * @see LogEncoder#of(LogFormatter)
155                 */
156                public Builder formatter(LogFormatter formatter) {
157                        this.encoder = Provider.of(LogEncoder.of(formatter));
158                        return this;
159                }
160
161                /**
162                 * Sets formatter as encoder.
163                 * @param formatter formatter to be converted to encoder.
164                 * @return builder.
165                 * @see LogEncoder#of(LogFormatter)
166                 */
167                public Builder formatter(LogFormatter.EventFormatter formatter) {
168                        this.encoder = Provider.of(LogEncoder.of(formatter));
169                        return this;
170                }
171
172                /**
173                 * Sets encoder.
174                 * @param encoder encoder not <code>null</code>.
175                 * @return builder.
176                 */
177                public Builder encoder(Provider<LogEncoder> encoder) {
178                        this.encoder = encoder;
179                        return this;
180                }
181
182                /**
183                 * Sets encoder.
184                 * @param encoder encoder not <code>null</code>.
185                 * @return builder.
186                 */
187                public Builder encoder(LogEncoder encoder) {
188                        this.encoder = Provider.of(encoder);
189                        return this;
190                }
191
192                /**
193                 * Builds.
194                 * @return an appender factory.
195                 */
196                public Provider<LogAppender> build() {
197                        /*
198                         * We need to capture parameters since appender creation needs to be lazy.
199                         */
200                        var _name = name;
201                        var _output = output;
202                        var _encoder = encoder;
203                        return (n, config) -> {
204                                AppenderConfig a = new AppenderConfig(_name, Provider.provideOrNull(n, _output, config),
205                                                Provider.provideOrNull(n, _encoder, config));
206                                return DefaultAppenderRegistry.appender(a, config);
207                        };
208                }
209
210        }
211
212        @Override
213        public void close();
214
215        /**
216         * An appender that can be used by a {@link LogPublisher.SyncLogPublisher}.
217         */
218        public interface ThreadSafeLogAppender extends LogAppender {
219
220                /**
221                 * Make an appender thread safe if is not already thread safe.
222                 * @param appender appender.
223                 * @return new thread safe appender if is not one or the passed in appender if it
224                 * thread safe.
225                 */
226                public static ThreadSafeLogAppender of(LogAppender appender) {
227                        if (appender instanceof ThreadSafeLogAppender lo) {
228                                return lo;
229                        }
230                        return DefaultLogAppender.threadSafeAppender.apply(appender);
231                }
232
233        }
234
235        /**
236         * An abstract appender to help create custom appenders.
237         */
238        abstract class AbstractLogAppender implements LogAppender {
239
240                /**
241                 * output
242                 */
243                protected final LogOutput output;
244
245                /**
246                 * encoder
247                 */
248                protected final LogEncoder encoder;
249
250                /**
251                 * Creates an appender from an output and encoder.
252                 * @param output
253                 * @param encoder
254                 */
255                protected AbstractLogAppender(LogOutput output, LogEncoder encoder) {
256                        super();
257                        this.output = output;
258                        this.encoder = encoder;
259                }
260
261                @Override
262                public final void append(LogEvent event) {
263                        try (var buffer = encoder.buffer()) {
264                                append(event, buffer);
265                        }
266                }
267
268                @Override
269                public void append(LogEvent[] events, int count) {
270                        try (var buffer = encoder.buffer()) {
271                                append(events, count, buffer);
272                        }
273                }
274
275                protected void append(LogEvent[] events, int count, Buffer buffer) {
276                        for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
277                                append(events[i], buffer);
278                                buffer.clear();
279                        }
280                }
281
282                protected abstract void append(LogEvent event, Buffer buffer);
283
284                @Override
285                public void start(LogConfig config) {
286                        output.start(config);
287                }
288
289                @Override
290                public void close() {
291                        output.close();
292                }
293
294        }
295
296}
297
298record CompositeLogAppender(LogAppender[] appenders) implements LogAppender {
299
300        public void append(LogEvent[] event, int count) {
301                for (var appender : appenders) {
302                        appender.append(event, count);
303                }
304        }
305
306        @Override
307        public void append(LogEvent event) {
308                for (var appender : appenders) {
309                        appender.append(event);
310                }
311        }
312
313        @Override
314        public void close() {
315                for (var appender : appenders) {
316                        appender.close();
317                }
318        }
319
320        @Override
321        public void start(LogConfig config) {
322                for (var appender : appenders) {
323                        appender.start(config);
324                }
325        }
326
327}
328
329class LockingLogAppender implements ThreadSafeLogAppender {
330
331        private final LogAppender appender;
332
333        private final ReentrantLock lock = new ReentrantLock();
334
335        public LockingLogAppender(LogAppender appender) {
336                this.appender = appender;
337        }
338
339        @Override
340        public void append(LogEvent[] events, int count) {
341                lock.lock();
342                try {
343                        appender.append(events, count);
344                }
345                finally {
346                        lock.unlock();
347                }
348        }
349
350        @Override
351        public void append(LogEvent event) {
352                LogEventConsumer a = appender;
353                lock.lock();
354                try {
355                        a.append(event);
356                }
357                finally {
358                        lock.unlock();
359                }
360
361        }
362
363        @Override
364        public void start(LogConfig config) {
365                appender.start(config);
366        }
367
368        @Override
369        public void close() {
370                appender.close();
371        }
372
373}
374
375/*
376 * The idea here is to have the virtual thread do the formatting outside of the lock
377 */
378class DefaultLogAppender extends AbstractLogAppender implements ThreadSafeLogAppender {
379
380        static Function<LogAppender, ThreadSafeLogAppender> threadSafeAppender = (appender) -> {
381                return new LockingLogAppender(appender);
382        };
383
384        protected final ReentrantLock lock = new ReentrantLock();
385
386        public DefaultLogAppender(LogOutput output, LogEncoder encoder) {
387                super(output, encoder);
388        }
389
390        @Override
391        protected void append(LogEvent[] events, int count, Buffer buffer) {
392                lock.lock();
393                try {
394                        for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
395                                append(events[i], buffer);
396                        }
397                }
398                finally {
399                        lock.unlock();
400                }
401
402        }
403
404        protected void append(LogEvent event, Buffer buffer) {
405                encoder.encode(event, buffer);
406                lock.lock();
407                try {
408                        buffer.drain(output, event);
409                        output.flush();
410                }
411                finally {
412                        lock.unlock();
413                }
414        }
415
416        @Override
417        public void close() {
418                lock.lock();
419                try {
420                        super.close();
421                }
422                finally {
423                        lock.unlock();
424                }
425        }
426
427}
428
429class BufferLogAppender extends AbstractLogAppender {
430
431        public BufferLogAppender(LogOutput output, LogEncoder encoder) {
432                super(output, CachedEncoder.of(encoder));
433        }
434
435        @Override
436        protected void append(LogEvent event, Buffer buffer) {
437                buffer.drain(output, event);
438        }
439
440}
